item.title: Teaching Statement
item.description: I love to train the next generation of hydrologists and environmental scientists. Just as the invention of computer to realize the ideas in sciences, the numeric modeling also provides flexible and assessable perspective on the watershed and the nature-human relationship. It is my belief that every student is capable of tasting the passion that I feel for hydrologic modeling by becoming practitioner in the exploration of hydrological theories, researches and models.

item.title: Geospatial and Geostatistical Analysis with R
Numeric Methods in Hydrology
item.description: Objective The objective to this class is to learn the steps involved in developing mathematical models for applied environmental/water resources problems, and using numerical methods to solve these mathematical models. To become familiar with: explicit method, implicit method, Linear/Non-Linear Partial Differential Equations (PDE), and numeric solutions for advection-dispersion equations.
